The Adonis blue is associated with calcareous grasslands, where its larval host plants, such as various species of Hippocrepis and Anthyllis, are found. The larvae feed on the flowers and young pods of these plants, and the adults primarily feed on the nectar of small, open flowers.

This species is sensitive to changes in its habitat and is considered threatened in some parts of its range due to factors such as habitat loss, overgrazing, and climate change. Conservation efforts have been implemented in certain regions to protect the Adonis blue and its fragile ecosystem.
